item.title: SOLID - Dependency Inversion Principle
item.description: The Dependency Inversion Principle emphasizes that high-level modules should not depend on low-level modules; both should depend on abstractions. Additionally, abstractions should not depend on details; instead, details should depend on abstractions. This principle encourages the use of interfaces or abstract classes to decouple higher-level and lower-level modules.
